text:
Pretty good. It not my favorite. Kinda tastes like a bud light on steroids with some peroni mixed in there. Why does this app make me write comments? Just want to rate beers for my own recording. Have I hit 75 character yet?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml growler, filled 4 hours ago. Thanks going to Adam and heather_B, so much thanks! Ever time I sip this I think about Great Lakes Dortmunder gold Nose of sweet malt, subtle grains and lager yeast. Flavor and aroma goes hand -in-hand. Light sweet and medium sweetness with a backbone of grain, subtle corn. 
Lighter body with a clean finish. The body is almost medium, good crispness. Overall: No brewer has done this style this well since Great Lakes. Wonderful example of the style. Mr. Hill is spot on style guidelines yet again.

On tap at HF. Light and clean, with a bit of grain flavor, a really soft mouthfeel, and a quick finish. Like a lighter, easier drinking Mary. Its almost unfair that HF can dominate any style they make.

Pours pale gold into a willi. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes to skim surface. Cracked malt and hay aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and hay front to back. Lasting mild bitter earth finish. Nice.

1L Glass, via Draft. Pours a hazy yellow, smells great. Fresh roasted nuts, pine needles, orange peel, juicy pineapple. Mouthfeel is dense, filling, well carbonated and has an oily thick finish. Flavor is akin to aroma. It is most certainly a lager but with a little hop profile that makes you want more. I actually ended up having this and a macro Helles side by side and the flavor on this out rageously better.

750 mL growler. Pale yellow. Smells of a little bit of earthy and spicy hops. Strong bready and doughy malt presence. Tastes bready, spicy, and a touch sweet as the hop flavor dies down. Spicy and earthy hop finish. Light body. Not sure why, but I expected a little more heft and hop from this. Soft carbonation. Its subtle and subdued, which I should have expected from HF.  At first, I thought, yeah ok its just a lager, but a return to it after drinking some HF IPAs made me really appreciate it.  Maybe as a US craft beer drinker I dont get to try many good pilsners and helles lagers, but I still thought this was more enjoyable without being more flavorful.

Growler, thanks Collin. Clear pale yellow pour with a small white head. Mild Pilsner bouquet. Lots of flavor and a very good mouthfeel for this style of beer. Its still got that light Pilsner/Lager style flair profile with very mellow biscuit qualitites. Easy drinking with Uber mild hop bitterness.

Draft at Prohibition Pig. Ive already spent enough on beer in the last two days to last me a year, but what kind of a RBian would I be if I didnt tick a few more before bed? Clear pale pour, small white ring of head, okay retention, irregular lacing. Smells nice - biscuit, corn, light honey. Good clean and smooth. Medium sweetness, short finish. Feels soft in the way these HF beers often seem to. Light body, pleasant carbonation. Easy to crush. Feels basically like a non-aggressive pilsner.
Growler @ the office. Pours a clear golden colour with a small white head. Nose is a sweet bready malts. Flavour is crisp, bready, slight sweet, refreshing. Not bad.

Growler, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike!), pours a clear blonde with a small white head. Aroma is super fresh, with lots of herbaceous notes, light grass and biscuity malt. Flavour is likewise fresh, with lots of herbaceous notes, biscuity malt, a touch of hay and light grass. Fresh, correct dryness and light grass. For the style, lovely.
Growler - Grainy and some sweetness. Pale yellow gold with a small white head. Light grains and some sweetness with just a touch of bitterness. Decent.

750ml growler shared at Brians office. Consume by 2017-05-25. Pours a clear blonde with a weak white head. Aroma is crispy, flowery, grany. Same taste with bready aftertaste. Refreshing. It is very nice if you like this style, but its just not my thing :-)

Growler from Al at Ryans May 2017 tasting; several drafts throughout the city. Pours a clear golden body with light white ring of lace. Nose is clean, crisp corn, pale malt and lager-notes. Faint hops waft to the nose. Mouthfeel is clean, crisp and sessionable - slightly hopped lager with absolutely no flaws. Damn.

Pours a very clear golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of honey malt and herbs/noble hops. Taste is more of the noble hops with crispy cereals in the back. Body is light to medium, carbonation moderate. A bit thin perhaps but it is even more easy drinking because of that. Overall a nice and crisp german style beer. Not americanized in any way to me and just really, really good.
Pale hazy gold with a white lacing. The aroma is bread, floral hops, cereal and faint citrus

Draft to pint. Looks good for the style; a transparent lighter gold with white head. Smells of a nice balance of mild hops, biscuit, and lager yeast. Tastes like it smells with a crisp, clean medium light-bodied mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
On tap with LKS at Proletariat. Clear gold, thin white lace. Aroma is clean clear lager, hay, grass, cracker malt, earth. Nice clean lager.

Growler (750 ml) shard at tasting. Crystal clear pale golden with a light-medium white head and some lacing. Aroma is of honeyed malts, herbal/grassy hops, fresh cereals, bread and light spiciness. Taste is so crisp with lovely honeyed malts, grassy notes and fresh cereals. Medium-light body. Moderate carbonation. Cushy mouthfeel. Crisp and clean. So refreshing and drinkable.

growler shared by tom10101, thanks yo. pours hazy pale but bright yellow with a nice white cap offering some retention and lacing. fresh cracking cereals, tons of fruity maltiness, freshly harvested grains, gold hay, grassy and herbal leafy noble goodness, very clean german yeast action. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; balanced citrusy-herbal finish. solid helles.

Growler thanks to Jao. Clear pale gold pour with rich white head. Aroma is really great, super crisp fresh, bready malt notes nice noble hop aroma, very fresh, grassy. Taste is very lightly bitter, fresh bread, soft hay like notes. Palate is light bodied, fluffy. So pleasant and easy to drink, I wish I could live around the corner from Hill Farmstead and just drink pints of this.

Fresh growler care of Uncle Albert, pours a lightly hazy golden with small white head. Notes of corn, grass, cereal malt, light perfumes, grapes and lager yeast. Clean, crisp, and refreshing which is what I want in a helles.

Draught. Pours a clear straw yellow with a large, foamy white head. Aroma is grassy with some yeast. Taste is sweet grain, cereal, grass, and yeast. Very, very light citrus in the finish. Yeast lingers. Light body. Average carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel.

Draft at Armsby Abbey. Pours golden with a thick white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Subtle grass notes on the nose. Soft, creamy, and luminous on the tongue with some nice graham cracker malt notes. Ive never head a Helles that felt this luxurious.

NEW BEER, FIRST RATE. 
CRED CHECK: http://i.imgur.com/liljlWp.jpeg

Pours as seen in pic. Aroma of noble hops, grass. Slightly sweet in the mouth. Grassy and thin bodied. Meh. Im just gonna call this like it is, it is average at best.
